message.entry: ROS Device Connection Test
Pinging device ''{0}''.
Successfully pinged device.
Unable to ping device. Check the device address.
Establishing connection to device ''{0}'' at SSH port {1,number,integer}. Connecting with username ''{2}''.
Successfully connected to device.
Unable to connect to device. Check that the device address, username, and password are correct.
Testing privilege level of user ''{0}''.
sudo requires password.
passwordless sudo
The user has administrative privileges ({0}). Both single-tasking and multi-tasking models can be deployed to the device.

The user does not have administrative privileges. Deployment of multi-tasking models is not possible. The ''{0}'' model uses tasking mode ''{1}''. Click ''Open'' to see additional information. <actions exclusiveFixIts="yes"> <action type="suggestion"> <cmd>helpview(fullfile(docroot, 'ros','ug','generate-a-standalone-ros-node-from-simulink.html'))</cmd> <txt>Open help page with additional information on the tasking mode setting</txt> </action> </actions>
Detecting installed ROS distribution.
Checking in folder ''{0}''.
Found ROS distribution ''{0}'' in folder ''{1}''.

Unable to find ROS distribution in folder ''{0}''. Click one of the suggested ''Fix'' buttons. <actions exclusiveFixIts="no"> <action type="fixit"> <cmd>ros.slros.internal.diag.recoverROSFolderFromWorkspace(''{1}'', {2,number,integer}, ''{3}'', ''{4}'', ''{5}'', ''{6}'' )</cmd> <txt>Recover ROS folder name from Catkin workspace ''{5}''</txt> </action> <action type="fixit"> <cmd>ros.slros.internal.diag.recoverROSFolderFromStdLocation(''{1}'', {2,number,integer}, ''{3}'', ''{4}'', ''{6}'' )</cmd> <txt>Search standard ROS installation folders</txt> </action> </actions>

Unable to find ROS 2 distribution in folder ''{0}''. Click one of the suggested ''Fix'' buttons. <actions exclusiveFixIts="no"> <action type="fixit"> <cmd>ros.slros.internal.diag.recoverROS2FolderFromWorkspace(''{1}'', {2,number,integer}, ''{3}'', ''{4}'', ''{5}'', ''{6}'' )</cmd> <txt>Recover ROS folder name from ROS 2 workspace ''{5}''</txt> </action> <action type="fixit"> <cmd>ros.slros.internal.diag.recoverROS2FolderFromStdLocation(''{1}'', {2,number,integer}, ''{3}'', ''{4}'', ''{6}'' )</cmd> <txt>Search standard ROS 2 installation folders</txt> </action> </actions>
Invalid Catkin workspace ''{0}'' or unable to recover ROS folder from workspace.
Invalid ROS 2 (colcon) workspace ''{0}'' or unable to recover ROS 2 folder from the workspace.
Unable to find any ROS distributions in the standard installation folders.
Unable to find any ROS 2 distributions in the standard installation folders.

Unable to find ROS distribution in folder ''{0}''. Click the ''Fix'' button for additional help. <actions exclusiveFixIts="yes"> <action type="fixit"> <cmd>ros.slros.internal.diag.recoverROSFolderFromStdLocation(''{1}'', {2,number,integer}, ''{3}'', ''{4}'', ''{5}'' )</cmd> <txt>Search standard ROS installation folders</txt> </action> </actions>

Unable to find ROS 2 distribution in folder ''{0}''. Click the ''Fix'' button for additional help. <actions exclusiveFixIts="yes"> <action type="fixit"> <cmd>ros.slros.internal.diag.recoverROS2FolderFromStdLocation(''{1}'', {2,number,integer}, ''{3}'', ''{4}'', ''{5}'' )</cmd> <txt>Search standard ROS 2 installation folders</txt> </action> </actions>
Found ROS distribution ''{0}'' in folder ''{1}''. The ''ROS folder'' field in the connection dialog is set to ''{1}''.
Found ROS 2 distribution ''{0}'' in folder ''{1}''. The ''ROS 2 folder'' field in the connection dialog is set to ''{1}''.
Found ROS distribution ''{0}'' in folder ''{1}''. To use this distribution, set the ''ROS folder'' field in the connection dialog to ''{1}''.
Found ROS 2 distribution ''{0}'' in folder ''{1}''. If you wish to use this distribution, please set the ''ROS 2 folder'' field in the connection dialog to ''{1}''.
Verifying Catkin workspace in ''{0}''.
Verifying ROS 2 workspace in ''{0}''.

Folder ''{0}'' does not exist. Click ''Fix'' to create the folder. <actions exclusiveFixIts="yes"> <action type="fixit"> <cmd>ros.slros.internal.diag.createFolderOnDevice(''{1}'', {2,number,integer}, ''{3}'', ''{4}'', ''{0}'')</cmd> <txt>Create folder on device</txt> </action> </actions>

Folder ''{0}'' does not exist. Click ''Fix'' to create the folder and initialize the Catkin workspace. <actions exclusiveFixIts="yes"> <action type="fixit"> <cmd>ros.slros.internal.diag.createCatkinWorkspace(''{1}'', {2,number,integer}, ''{3}'', ''{4}'', ''{5}'', ''{0}'')</cmd> <txt>Create folder and initialize Catkin workspace on device</txt> </action> </actions>

Folder ''{0}'' does not exist. Click ''Fix'' to create the folder and initialize the ROS 2 workspace. <actions exclusiveFixIts="yes"> <action type="fixit"> <cmd>ros.slros.internal.diag.createROS2Workspace(''{1}'', {2,number,integer}, ''{3}'', ''{4}'', ''{5}'', ''{0}'')</cmd> <txt>Create folder and initialize ROS 2 workspace on device</txt> </action> </actions>
Successfully created folder ''{0}''.
Successfully created Catkin workspace in ''{0}''.
Successfully created ROS 2 (colcon) workspace in ''{0}''.
Folder exists.
Folder is not writable by user ''{0}''. Change the folder permissions or select a different Catkin workspace.
Folder is writable.

Folder ''{0}'' does not contain a valid Catkin workspace. Click the ''Fix'' button to initialize the Catkin workspace. <actions exclusiveFixIts="yes"> <action type="fixit"> <cmd>ros.slros.internal.diag.createCatkinWorkspace(''{1}'', {2,number,integer}, ''{3}'', ''{4}'', ''{5}'', ''{0}'')</cmd> <txt>Initialize Catkin workspace in folder</txt> </action> </actions>

Folder ''{0}'' does not contain a valid ROS 2 workspace. Click the ''Fix'' button to initialize the ROS 2 workspace. <actions exclusiveFixIts="yes"> <action type="fixit"> <cmd>ros.slros.internal.diag.createROS2Workspace(''{1}'', {2,number,integer}, ''{3}'', ''{4}'', ''{5}'', ''{0}'')</cmd> <txt>Initialize ROS 2 workspace in folder</txt> </action> </actions>

Folder ''{0}'' does not contain a valid Catkin workspace. Unable to automatically create a workspace, because the ''ROS folder'' setting is invalid. Manually create a Catkin workspace with ''catkin_init_workspace'' and ''catkin_make''.

Folder ''{0}'' does not contain a valid ROS 2 workspace. Unable to automatically create a workspace, because the ''ROS 2 folder'' setting is invalid. Manually create a ROS 2 workspace and initialize with ''colcon build''.
Folder contains a valid Catkin workspace.
Folder contains a valid ROS 2 workspace.
Disconnecting from device ''{0}''.
Done with connection test.
